I just moved into a town and am thinking about getting cable hooked up in my appartment. My question is i have a normal 56k modem and i have an ethrnet connection in my computer so i need a cable modem right i heard it pluged into the ethernet connection but where do i get it does it come with the cable? Do have to get it from the provider? I went into a computer store (staples buisness depot) and the guy only wanted to sell me the eathernet card/conection i already have. Where do i get the cable modem? And will any tv plug inot cable do i need any other adaptors? I feel like an ass i know nothing at all about cable. HELP!!!!

------------------

You'd have to contact the cable company to see if they provide internet access. Most do.

I don't know how this particuliar cable compant works, but the cable provider I am on provides it's customers with a cable modem. The "rent" of the cable modem is thrown in with the internet connection fee.

If you leave their service, you give the modem back, if you have a problem with the modem, they come and replace it free of charge.

You can use the existing ethernet card in your PC now ( my provider provides a free card, replacements you pay for).

If you call your cable co, they should have all the answers you need.

Once you go cable internet, you'll shudder at just the thought of dial-up.

[This message has been edited by jelly2m8 (edited 05-08-2004).]

The purpose of the cable modem is to convert the data signal on the cable line to an ethernet signal (TCP/IP) that your PC can use via it's ethernet card/adapter. You can buy your own cable modem, or rent one from the cable company for a small charge, your choice. You will need to find out from the cable company what modems are compatible with their cable system. It is much simpler than it first appears. The first step is to call the cable company and then you go from there.

JazzMan

Your provider will give you the cable modem to use

Make sure to tell them your PC has an ethernet card already, make sure they send you a modem that will use ethernet and not usb (they suck)

Your provider will probably install a new box to use for the internet access, as the one you have now probably dosent support it.

Just give them a call and tell them you have a network ready PC and need an ehternet ready modem.

They will help you, thats what you are paying them for.

Good luck

Jake

Cable comes out of the wall using coaxial cable and connects to a cable modem provided by the cable company. A standard Cat 5 cable goes from the modem to the nic card. All of this was provided by my cable company, Road Runner. I don't know that all cable companies work this way. Call the service department and ask how their setup is configured. Then you will know what you have to provide. I would buy a firewall router to put between the modem and the puter. This provides very good security and will also allow you to share the connection with other computers in your dwelling. You must have a firewall or your puter is open to anyone who wishes to use it. I don't use a wireless cable connection because I don't think it is as secure or as fast as the hardwire connect.

There are lots of free security proggies, including software firewalls, in this thread:

https://www.fiero.nl/forum/Forum6/HTML/018728.html

I haven't seen a TV manufactured in years, that was not cable ready.

Cable just screws onto the connector on the back of the TV.

If they offer digital, or certain pay channels the may require you to rent a Converter Box or Digital box from the cable provider.

And as stated above, call your cable company before buying a modem. Make sure Internet is an option with them.

These are MODEMS that Adelphia recommends.....

The MODEM MUST BE DOCSIS Compliant.

Broadxent 8601

Com21 DP1110XB

D-Link DCM200

Linksys BEFCMU10 ver.2

Motorola SB3100

Motorola SB4100

Motorola SB4101

Motorola SB4200

Motorola SB4220

Motorola SB5100

RCA DCM245R

RCA DCM315

Scientific Atlanta DPX100

Scientific Atlanta DPX2100

Terayon TJ715

Terayon TJ715X

Toshiba PCX1100U

Toshiba PCX2200

Zoom 5041

Zyxel 5041

Zyxel P944

Zyxel P946
